source_sentence: 佛說兜調經
translation: Foshuo douti jing

source_sentence: 失譯人名今附東晉錄
translation: Lost Translator's Names Now Attached to the Records of the Eastern Jin Dynasty

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在舍衛國。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the country of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 國中有一婆羅門，名曰兜調，有子名曰谷。
translation: In that country, there was a Brāhmaṇa named Dhūtaka who had a son named Ku.

source_sentence: 兜調為人急弊，常憙罵詈，身死還自為其家作狗子，名曰騾。
translation: Toddy was a man of great anger and abuse, and when he died, he made himself a dog named Mule for his family.

source_sentence: 其子谷者愛是狗子，為著金鏁，牀臥常以氍氀毾[毯-炎+登]，食以金盤美食。
translation: His son, Gu, loved that dog, so he wore a gold hood, always had carpets and coats [blankets-yang+deng] for sleeping, and ate from a gold dish.

source_sentence: 谷出至市，佛過谷門，白狗嚇佛。
translation: When Gu went out to the market and the Buddha passed through the door, the white dog scared the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛即言：「汝平常時舉手言咆，今反作狗嚇，不知慚愧。」
translation: The Buddha then said, "You usually raise your hand and say, 'Growl!' but now you act like a dog and scare him, not knowing how ashamed you are."

source_sentence: 狗便慚走，持頭面插牀下啼淚出。
translation: The dog then walked away in shame, put its head under the bed, and cried out in tears.

source_sentence: 佛去後，狗不復上所臥牀，便寢臥地，食之不食。
translation: After the Buddha left, the dog didn't get back on the bed where it was lying, so it went to sleep and lay on the ground, not eating.

source_sentence: 谷從外來，見狗不食，問家言：「狗何為如是？」
translation: When Gu came from outside, he saw that the dog wasn't eating and asked, "Why is the dog like this?"

source_sentence: 家言：「屬者有一沙門來過，不審何言？
translation: The householder said, "An ascetic has come and gone, but I don't know what he said.

source_sentence: 狗因走入牀下臥地，食之不食。」
translation: The dog then went under the bed and lay down on the ground, eating it and not eating it."

source_sentence: 谷言：「沙門向何道去？」
translation: Gu said, "Which way did the monk go?"

source_sentence: 家言：「東去。」
translation: The householder said, "Go east!"

source_sentence: 谷即隨而追及。
translation: The valley then followed and pursued them.

source_sentence: 佛於樹下為諸比丘說經，佛遙見谷來，佛告諸比丘：「谷來不至道，死者便墮地獄中。」
translation: As the Buddha was teaching the sūtras to the monks under the trees, he saw the valley coming from a distance, and he told the monks, "If the valley doesn't reach the road, the dead will fall into hell."

source_sentence: 諸比丘問佛：「何為墮地獄中？」
translation: The monks asked the Buddha, "What is it that falls into hell?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「是人持惡意來，欲害人故，當墮地獄中。」
translation: The Buddha said, "That person comes with bad intentions and wants to harm people, so they'll fall into hell."

source_sentence: 谷至佛前，因問：「屬者何沙門過我門罵我狗？
translation: When the monk approached the Buddha, he asked, "Which ascetic passed through my door and scolded my dog?

source_sentence: 令不食、不臥其處。」
translation: He made them stop eating and stop lying down in their places."

source_sentence: 佛即報言：「我過汝門，白狗嚇我，即謂言：『汝平常時舉手言咆，今反作狗嚇，不知慚愧！』
translation: The Buddha then reported, "When I passed through your door, the white dog scared me, saying, 'Normally, you raise your hand and say, 'Growl!' but now you act like a dog and scare me, not knowing shame!'

source_sentence: 狗便慚走，持頭面插牀下啼淚出。」
translation: The dog then walked away in shame, thrust its head under the bed, and burst into tears."

source_sentence: 谷問佛：「是狗於我何等耶？」
translation: Gu asked the Buddha, "What kind of dog is this to me?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「不須問，聞者令汝不樂。」
translation: The Buddha said, "There's no need to ask, for hearing it will make you unhappy."

source_sentence: 谷言：「聽，為我說之。」
translation: The monk said, "Listen, tell it for me."

source_sentence: 佛言：「說者令汝瞋怒。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Telling it will make you angry."

source_sentence: 谷言：「不敢瞋。
translation: The monk said, "I dare not be angry.

source_sentence: 願欲聞之。」
translation: I want to hear it."

source_sentence: 佛言：「是汝父兜調也。」
translation: The Buddha said, "It's your father, Dhūti, too."

source_sentence: 谷言：「我父兜調在世時明經道經，不作狗。」
translation: Gu said, "When my father Dhūtaka was alive, he knew the sūtras and path sūtras and didn't work as a dog."

source_sentence: 佛言：「但坐所知自貢高，故作狗耳。
translation: The Buddha said, "He was just sitting there knowing how to flatter himself, so he acted like a dog.

source_sentence: 汝欲知審是汝父不？
translation: Do you want to know whether this is your father?

source_sentence: 還歸於家，語狗言：『汝審是我父兜調者，當於故器中食。
translation: When he returned home, he said to the dog, 'You must have eaten from your old container, thinking it was my father, Tuṣita.

source_sentence: 汝審是我父者，當還於故處臥。
translation: You must examine him as my father; he must return to his old place and lie down there.

source_sentence: 汝審是我父者，先時所有珍寶藏物當示我處。』」
translation: You must examine this as my father, and you must show me the treasures and belongings you had before.'"

source_sentence: 谷即還歸，呼狗言：「騾！
translation: Gu then returned and called to the dog, saying, "Mule!

source_sentence: 汝審是我父兜調者，當食是食。」
translation: This is the food you'll eat if you judge it to be my father, Tuṣita."

source_sentence: 狗即食其食。
translation: The dog then ate his food.

source_sentence: 谷復言：「騾！
translation: Again, Gu said, "Mule!

source_sentence: 汝審是我父者，當臥故處。」
translation: You must examine him as my father; he must lie down at his former place."

source_sentence: 狗即臥故處。
translation: The dog then went to lie down at his old haunts.

source_sentence: 谷復言：「騾！
translation: Again, Gu said, "Mule!

source_sentence: 汝審是我父者，先時所有珍寶藏物當示我處。」
translation: You must examine him as my father, and he will show me where he stored all the treasures he had."

source_sentence: 狗即以口指牀右足下，以前兩足爬地示之。
translation: The dog then pointed with his mouth under the right foot of the bed and showed it to him by crawling on the ground with his first two feet.

source_sentence: 谷即掘騾所爬地，得珍寶琦物甚眾多。
translation: Gu then dug into the ground where Mule was crawling and found a great many treasures and valuable things.

source_sentence: 谷大歡喜，因還到佛所。
translation: Rejoicing greatly, Gu returned to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛遙見之，告諸比丘：「今谷來，不至道，死者即生天上。」
translation: Seeing him from a distance, the Buddha told the monks, "Now, the valley comes, doesn't reach the path, and its dead will be born in heaven."

source_sentence: 諸比丘問佛：「何因緣得生天上？」
translation: The monks asked the Buddha, "What are the causes for being born in heaven?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「是人持善意來故，當生天上。」
translation: The Buddha said, "This person will be born in heaven because they came with good intentions."

source_sentence: 谷到佛所，前為佛作禮，白佛言：「審如佛語。」
translation: Gu went to the Buddha, paid homage to him, and said to him, "I've heard what he said."

source_sentence: 谷復問佛言：「人居世間，何故獨有壽者、有不壽者？
translation: Again, Gu asked the Buddha, "When people live in the world, why are there people who live and those who don't live alone?

source_sentence: 何故獨有多病者、有少病者？
translation: Why is it that there are those who are sick and those who are less sick alone?

source_sentence: 何故面獨有好色者、有惡色者？
translation: Why is there a person with a good color or a bad color alone?

source_sentence: 何故獨有尊者、有卑者？
translation: Why is there an honored one and a humble one alone?

source_sentence: 何故獨有媚者、有不媚者？
translation: Why are there those who flatter and those who do not flatter independent of each other?

source_sentence: 何故獨有富者、有貧者？
translation: Why are there rich people and poor people alone?

source_sentence: 何故獨有明者、有愚者？」
translation: Why is there a wise and a foolish person alone?"

source_sentence: 佛告谷：「人於世間憙殺生，無慈心者，死入地獄中；地獄中罪竟，復為人，即不壽。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "A person who kills beings in the world and lacks compassion will die and go to hell; after completing their crimes in hell, they'll become a human again, which means they won't live long.

source_sentence: 人於世間不殺生，有慈心，死上天；從天來下生人間，即長壽。
translation: When a person doesn't kill beings in the world and has kindness, he'll die and go up to heaven; when he comes down from heaven to live among humans, he'll have a long life.

source_sentence: 人於世間憙鬪亂，持刀杖恐人，死入地獄中；地獄中罪竟，復為人，即多病。
translation: A person who is jealous of the world and has fights against people with swords and staves will die in hell; after committing a sin in hell, he'll become a human again, which means he'll be very sick.

source_sentence: 人於世間喜和合，不持刀杖恐人，死生天上；從天來下生人間，即少病。
translation: A person who enjoys worldly harmony and doesn't fear people with a sword and stick will die and be born up in heaven; when they come down from heaven to live among humans, they'll have few illnesses.

source_sentence: 人於世間喜瞋怒，聞善語亦怒，聞惡語亦怒，見賢者亦怒，見愚者亦怒，不別善惡但欲瞋怒，死入地獄中；地獄中罪竟，復為人，面無色萎黃熟。
translation: In the world, a person is attracted to anger, becomes angry when he hears good words, becomes angry when he hears bad words, becomes angry when he sees a good person, becomes angry when he sees a foolish person, and doesn't discriminate between good and evil but wants to be angry, which results in death in hell; after the misdeeds in hell are completed, he'll return to being a human being with a discolored face that's yellow and ripe.

source_sentence: 人於世間不瞋不怒，見賢者敬之，見愚者忍之，死上天；從天來下生人間，面色常好，為人和、心賢善。
translation: A person who doesn't become angry or resentful in the world and who respects the good and tolerates the foolish will die and go up to heaven; when they come down from heaven to live among humans, their countenance is always good, and they're a peaceful person with a good heart.

source_sentence: 人於世間不媚者，見老人不起，不孝父母，見父母不敬愛，人有孝順敬父母及長老者，常恚恨之，死入地獄中；地獄中罪竟，復為人，即不媚，為眾人所憎惡。
translation: When a person doesn't flatter the world, they don't look down on old people, don't honor their parents, don't respect their parents, and don't look kindly on their parents; if a person is dutiful and respectful to their parents and elders, they'll always hate them and die and go to hell; after completing their punishment in hell, they'll return to being a human being, which means they don't flatter and are hated by people.

source_sentence: 人於世間孝父母、敬長老，若有人不孝者、不敬長老者，輙往教之，喜為人說善言，死上天；從天來下生人間，為人所愛敬。
translation: If a person is dutiful to their parents and respects the elderly in the world, and if someone is unfilial and doesn't respect the elderly, they'll often go and teach them, speak well of their joy for others, and go up to heaven when they die; they'll come down from heaven to live among humans and be loved and respected by them.

source_sentence: 人於世間憍慢、不敬尊者，自用強梁，死入地獄中；地獄中罪竟，復為人，因作下賤。
translation: A person who is arrogant and disrespectful in the world will use a strong self-imposed beam and die in hell; after completing their crime in hell, they'll return to being a human being and be made to suffer a lowly fate.

source_sentence: 人於世間不憍慢、常敬尊者，用人不強梁，死上天；從天來下生人間，因作尊者。
translation: A person who isn't arrogant and always respects the honorable in the world uses people who aren't strong beams, and they die and go up to heaven; they come down from heaven to live among humans and are made an honorable person because of it.

source_sentence: 人於世間慳貪，雖富不惠施貧人、不視宗親、不喜布施，貪惜飲食，不施沙門道人，復不敢自飽，死入地獄中；地獄中罪竟，復為人；即貧賤乞匃。
translation: Being stingy and greedy in the world, a person doesn't patronize the poor even though they're rich, doesn't value their clan, doesn't like giving, and is greedy for food and drink; they don't dare to feed themselves and go to hell when they die; after their misdeeds in hell, they return to being a human being, which is to beg for food because they're poor and humble.

source_sentence: 人於世間無慳貪之心，為人無貧富，好布施沙門道人，施與貧者、愛視宗親，飯食常自飽滿，死上天；從天來下生，世富樂，為人所敬愛。
translation: That person has no desire for parsimony in the world, is not rich or poor, gives alms to ascetics, gives to the poor, and loves and respects their relatives, always fills their stomach with food, and goes up to heaven when they die; they are born from heaven, are prosperous, and are loved by people.

source_sentence: 人於世間聞有明經高遠，若沙門及道士，不好往問度世之道，心嫉高遠，死入地獄中；地獄中罪竟，復為人，即愚癡，無所識知，與畜生同伍。
translation: If ascetics and Daoists don't ask about the way to save the world and become jealous of its noble character, they'll die and go to hell; after completing their crimes in hell, they'll become human again, which means they're foolish, have no knowledge, and are kept company with animals.

source_sentence: 人於世間聞有明經高遠，若沙門道士，好往問度世之事，心不嫉妬，貪愛高遠，死即上天；從天來下生人間，為人即明經曉道，為眾人所尊用。」
translation: Here in the world, people hear that there are scriptures that are clear and lofty, and if an ascetic or religious man goes to ask about redeeming the world, his heart isn't jealous, and he loves loftiness, he'll go up to heaven when he dies; from heaven he'll come down to the human realm, become a human being, and then he'll know the scriptures and understand the path, which will be respected by all people."

source_sentence: 佛言：「人作善者得上天，為惡者下入地獄；人求壽得壽，求不壽得不壽，求病得病，求不病得不病，求面好色得面好色，求惡色得惡色，求尊者得尊者，求下賤得下賤，求媚得媚，求不媚得不媚，求富得富、求貧得貧，求智得智、求愚得愚。
translation: The Buddha said, "A person who does good deeds will go up to heaven, and a person who does evil will go down to hell; a person who seeks longevity will get longevity, who seeks non-living will get non-living, who seeks illness will get illness, who seeks non-illness will get non-illness, who seeks good looks on the face will get good looks on the face, who seeks bad looks will get bad looks, who seeks a venerable person will get venerable, who seeks lowliness will get lowliness, who seeks flattery will get flattery, who seeks non-flattery will get non-flattery, who seeks wealth will get wealthy, who seeks poverty will get poor, who seeks wisdom will get wise, and who seeks foolishness will get foolish.

source_sentence: 人於世間作善惡，譬如種穀得穀、種麥得麥、種稻得稻，作善得善、作惡得惡。」
translation: What people do in the world that's good and what's bad is like planting grain to get grain, wheat to get wheat, or rice to get rice; doing good to get good; and doing evil to get evil."

source_sentence: 谷即却長跪言：「前頭來時見狗不食，心懷瞋恚，愚癡故耳。
translation: The grain then withdrew and knelt down long enough to say, "When I first came here, I saw that the dog wasn't eating and I was angry at heart, which was foolishness.

source_sentence: 今佛所語，如盲得視、如聾得聽、如人墮深水得出、如狂癡得愈、如人行冥中得見日月。
translation: Now, the Buddha's words are like being blind and getting sight, deaf and getting hearing, like a person falling into deep water and escaping, like a person going crazy and getting healed, or like a person walking in the dark and seeing the sun and moon.

source_sentence: 願從佛求哀乞悔過，唯加大恩，即奉行五戒為優婆塞。」
translation: May I beg the Buddha to grant me the five precepts and become an upāsaka after he begs me to repent and grant me only great kindness."

source_sentence: 佛言：「後世人有諷誦是經者、若聽聞音聲者，心中惻然、衣毛為竪、淚即為出，如是者，其人皆當為彌勒佛作弟子，得度世去。」
translation: The Buddha said, "If people in the future recite this sūtra or hear its sounds, their hearts will be moved, their clothing hair will stand on end, and tears will flow out, and so they will all become disciples of Maitreya Buddha and be saved from the world."

source_sentence: 佛說兜調經
translation: Foshuo douti jing
